description:
As a Technical Account Manager, you are responsible for providing technical solutions and managing relationships with Google's largest and most strategic online publishers. As a liaison between clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations and integrations of a variety of our product lines (such as Search, Mobile, Video and Commerce). From monitoring product performance to debugging and troubleshooting product code, you are the resident expert that addresses partner needs. You are a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive and passion for client management.

The Android Partner Engineering team at Google works with the Android device ecosystem to extend the boundaries of the Android platform. The team works in a fast paced technology driven environment and is deeply engaged with Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM), carriers, chipset manufacturers and Original Device Manufacturers (ODM) across the globe. Our aim is to ensure devices are secure and up to date and make Android the platform of choice with consumers and enterprise customers.

As a Technical Solutions Consultant on the Android Partner Engineering team, you are the engagement manager taking responsibility for the success of our largest Android OEM and Carrier partnerships. You'll lead deployments and optimize implementations to increase business. You will drive new business opportunities and manage the overall technical aspects to build long-term partnerships.

Whether working with next-gen chipset manufacturers or emerging market telcos, Google's Android Partner Engineering team helps solve some of the toughest mobile technology problems. We work with teams throughout Google to develop solutions for strategic partners around the globe. We maintain crucial relationships with and build technical solutions for our long-term partners who are making Android into a world-changing platform. But we're just getting started.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience working in either; technical account management, product management, software engineering, or engineering program management.
  • Experience in working with computer languages (e.g. Java, C++ or Python) and familiarity working in Linux environments.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in mobile device/application development and an understanding of mobile ecosystem trends.
  • Ability to work with scripting languages such as; Python and Shell.
  • Track record of building successful relationships and influence with technical and executive audiences.
  • Excellent communication and project management skills, with a track record of handling multiple customers and streams of work.
  • Demonstrated creative problem-solving approach and excellent analytical skills.
responsibilities:
• Perform implementation reviews, advocate new product features, and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
  • Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams including Product Management, Business Development and Engineering.
  • Guarantee the technical aspects of a partner’s integration (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance.
  • Support efforts to enhance new business opportunities via Google technologies.
title: Technical Solutions Consultant, Android Partner Engineering
